text: Bernice Madigan (July 24, 1899 â€“ January 3, 2015) was an American supercentenarian and one of the last surviving person in the world who was born in the 1800s or the 19th century. She was the oldest living resident of Massachusetts,Cheshire Woman 16th Oldest in the World the fourth-oldest living person in the United States, and the world's fifth-oldest living person at the time of her death.Cheshire Woman Is Fourth Oldest in the World A lifelong Republican, she attended the Inauguration of Warren G. Harding in 1921, and cited Dwight D. Eisenhower and Ronald Reagan as her favorite U.S. Presidents. "Reagan accomplished more for the government. Eisenhower I thought was very good in some ways in the White House. I liked them both very much." Madigan met her husband, Paul, in Washington, and they were married 50 years. Paul died in 1976. She has outlived a brother, Roy Emerson, and a sister, Marilyn Emerson Martin. Madigan died in Cheshire, Massachusetts, aged 115. == Related pages == * List of American supercentenarians == References == Category:1899 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American supercentenarians Category:People from Massachusetts
title: Bernice Madigan
